intro: Mapouria cupularis, commonly known as the cupularia or the hooded bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture.
